talk.author: did:plc:bbs3a4ftyciog36fnttiiluc
talk.utter: I do not want my content scraped for generative content or machine learning by anyone. Not Bluesky, and certainly not an outsider to the site. I want access to features that allow me to control who can view my data and posts. Give us private profiles. Toggle NO as the default option for scraping.

talk.author: did:plc:e2px5buo4nj42ngnlrbddt3k
talk.utter:
The only way to achieve that (due to bad actors) is to not post content on the internet.

I applaud blueskys efforts here.

Compare this to email, any given SMTP Server doesn't have to respect anything you request. The same is true for the AT Protocol that underpins bluesky.

talk.author: did:plc:e2px5buo4nj42ngnlrbddt3k
talk.utter: And I realize your request asks for private things, but that would reduce, if not entirely negate the "billionaire proof" advantage of having the AT Protocol be an open standard.

talk.author: did:plc:bbs3a4ftyciog36fnttiiluc
talk.utter:
I appreciate you trying to explain this stuff to me but I don't know what this jargon means. I have no idea what an AT Protocol or any of the other things are.

Can you explain how asking for a way to private my profile is somehow going to give billionaires power on Bluesky? /gen
